item.title: List of alien races in DC Comics
item.description:
List of alien races in DC Comics ðŸ”—

This is a comprehensive list of extraterrestrial races that have appeared in DC Comics, including comic book titles and other media properties. It provides brief descriptions and citations for each race.

Contents ðŸ”—

This section lists all the sections in the article, organized alphabetically. It includes links to each section for easy navigation.

Overview ðŸ”—

This section provides a general introduction to the topic, noting the vast number of extraterrestrial races in the DC Comics universe and that most are humanoid.

United Planets ðŸ”—

This section discusses the United Planets, a governing body active from the 21st to the 31st centuries. It mentions known members like planets of the Solar System, Htrae, artificial planet-sized satellites, buffer planets seeded by Mon-El, and neighboring empires. It also notes that in the 21st century, the United Planets are led by the corrupt Durlan Thaaros. This section is marked as needing expansion.

0-9 ðŸ”—

This section lists alien races whose names begin with a number.

5th Dimensional Imps ðŸ”—

This section details the 5th Dimensional Imps, who originate from the planet Zrfff. Notable Imps include Mister Mxyzptlk, Miss Gsptlsnz, Vyndktvx, Brpxz, Mister Genie (Genro), Quisp, Bat-Mite, Kcid Nosyarg (Larry), Zook, Gazook, and Mopee.

5th Dimensional Imps in other media ðŸ”—

This section lists appearances of 5th Dimensional Imps in other media, such as the Supergirl TV series, where Mxyzptlk and Gsptlsnz/Nyxlygsptlnz appear. It also mentions the Music Meister being revealed as an imp in a Supergirl crossover with The Flash.

A ðŸ”—

This section lists alien races whose names begin with the letter “A”.

Adaptoids ðŸ”—

This section describes the Adaptoids, blob-like creatures from near Arcturus that attempted to wipe out the human race on Earth-One. They were defeated by the Justice League when exposed to the Thanagarian equalizing disease.

Aellans ðŸ”—

This section describes the Aellans, yellow-skinned reptilian humanoids from Aello (Stormswift). Demonia, Harpis and Doc of Aello were all members of the Omega Men.

Alien Invaders ðŸ”—

This section describes the Alien Invaders, the nameless primary antagonists of Armageddon: The Alien Agenda.

Almeraci ðŸ”—

This section details the Almeraci, a humanoid race of technologically advanced warriors with psionic abilities. They are ruled by the matriarchal House of the Blood Royale, which maintains its bloodline through selective breeding. Key members include Maxima (Queen of Almerac), her handmaiden Sazu, and Ultraa.

Aloi ðŸ”—

This section describes the Aloi, blue-skinned aliens with ridged foreheads at war with the Margoi over a device called the “Grayl”. They are represented by Tumlat.

Alstairans ðŸ”—

This section describes the Alstairans of Alstair, one of four technologically advanced spacefaring races native to the Antares system. They are plantlike humanoids with leaves instead of hair, and their ruler is Hyathis.

Anasazi ðŸ”—

This section describes the Anasazi, metahumans who were resettled to the planet Starhaven. Dawnstar represents this species.

Andromedans ðŸ”—

This section describes the Andromedans of the Andromeda Galaxy, a race of superhumans similar to Kryptonians and Daxamites. They have red hair, albino skin, and blue eyes. Karb-Brak, an Andromedan exiled to Earth, was eventually cured and returned to his homeworld.

Angtuans ðŸ”—

This section describes the Angtuans, inhabitants of the planet Angtu, which was destroyed by Mano in the 30th century.

Anunnake ðŸ”—

This section describes the Anunnake, reptilian aliens who claim to have killed off the dinosaurs and are also known as the Hunter/Gatherers.

Anndrann ðŸ”—

This section describes the Anndrann, green-skinned military geniuses from Anndranna, famed for their weapons of war. Iron has a deleterious effect on their cognitive abilities.

Appellaxians ðŸ”—

This section details the Appellaxians of Appellax, technologically advanced energy aliens with the ability to create powerful artificial host bodies. The seven Appellaxians that invaded created bodies named Golden Roc, Wood King, Stone-God, Crystal Creature, Fire-Lord, Glass-Man, and Mercury Monster. Their invasion led to the formation of the Justice League.

Appellaxians in other media ðŸ”—

This section lists appearances of the Appellaxians’ creations in other media, such as the Young Justice episode “Salvage,” where Bruno Mannheim combines them into a Golem.

Aipitons ðŸ”—

This section describes the Aipitons, a species of small flying insects from the planet Apaiton, represented by the deceased Green Lantern Bzzd.

Aquoids ðŸ”—

This section describes the Aquoids, natives of planet Beltair IV.

Aranes ðŸ”—

This section describes the Aranes of Arane II, light blue-skinned humanoids with white hair and tiny blue horns. Rolind Siepur of Arane II is a member of the Dark Circle.

Ardenans ðŸ”—

This section describes the Ardenans, sentient humanoids with orange scaly skin from the planet Arden, represented by the deceased Green Lanterns Lodar and Meeno Monak.

Astonians ðŸ”—

This section describes the Astonians, a minor alien race saved from extinction by the Blue Lantern Saint Walker, who is of this race.

Azarathians ðŸ”—

This section describes the Azarathians, people belonging to the parallel universe of Azarath. Raven is an Azarathian.

B ðŸ”—

This section lists alien races whose names begin with the letter “B”.

Barrions ðŸ”—

This section describes the Barrions of Barrio III, silicon-based lifeforms represented by the Green Lantern Chaselon.

Bellatrix Bombers ðŸ”—

This section describes the Bellatrix Bombers, alien warlords featured in Green Lantern (vol. 3) #20.

Bgztlians ðŸ”—

This section describes the Bgztlians, humans from the colony Bgztl who possess the metahuman ability of intangibility. Phantom Girl of the Legion of Super-Heroes represents them.

Blight ðŸ”—

This section describes the Blight, a cybernetic race whose bodies are composed of rotting flesh and villains of the Legion of Super-Heroes. Their leader is Atrophos.

Bloodline Parasites ðŸ”—

This section describes the Bloodline Parasites, extraterrestrial lifeforms capable of activating the human metagene while feeding on spinal fluid. They have dense exoskeletons, are incredibly strong, and can duplicate human form.

Braalians ðŸ”—

This section describes the Braalians, humans from the colony Braal who possess the metahuman ability of electromagnetic field manipulation. Cosmic Boy and Magno of the Legion of Super-Heroes represent them.

Brain-Parasites of Planet X ðŸ”—

This section describes the Brain-Parasites of Planet X, who use Knowledge-Extractors to steal knowledge from other races.

Branx ðŸ”—

This section describes the Branx of Emana Branx, a gray-skinned race of dull-witted, four-armed warriors who serve the Citadelians.

Brylyx ðŸ”—

This section describes the Brylyx, white-skinned aliens featured in Green Lantern: Mosaic.

The Bolovax Vikians ðŸ”—

This section describes the Bolovax Vikians, a highly communal and technologically advanced race from Bolovax Vik, now a dead race. Kilowog of the Green Lantern Corps is the last surviving member.

Bolovax Vikians in other media ðŸ”—

This section notes the appearance of a holographic Bolovax Vikian in the My Adventures with Superman episode “The Machine Who Would Be Empire”.

Bugs of New Genesis ðŸ”—

This section describes the Bugs of New Genesis, an insectoid race who thrive in colonies beneath the surface of the planet. Forager and Mantis are prominent members.

C ðŸ”—

This section lists alien races whose names begin with the letter “C”.

Cairnians ðŸ”—

This section mentions the Cairnians as members of L.E.G.I.O.N.

Calatonians ðŸ”—

This section describes the Calatonians, an ancient monarchy on the planet Calaton ravaged by the Doomsday creature.

Canopians ðŸ”—

This section mentions the Canopians as members of Atari Force. Canopians such as Morphea are from New Earth in a parallel universe.

Carggites ðŸ”—

This section describes the Carggites, humans from the colony Cargg who possess the metahuman ability of duplication. Triplicate Girl of the Legion of Super-Heroes represents them.

Catherix ðŸ”—

This section describes the Cathexis, alien super-scientists from the “sixth dimension” who created self-aware reality endangering technology.

Changralynians ðŸ”—

This section describes the Changralynians of Changralyn, a race of silicon-based pacifists represented by Broot of the Omega Men.

Chietain ðŸ”—

This section is marked as needing expansion.

source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martian_(DC_Comics)
